tuberculosis.teachingPoint: Caseating granulomas with central necrosis suggest mycobacterial infection (e.g., TB).
tuberculosis.caseContext: Tuberculosis typically shows caseating granulomas with Langhans giant cells. AFB staining may reveal acid-fast bacilli.

histoplasmosis.teachingPoint: Small intracellular yeast forms with narrow-based budding are characteristic of histoplasmosis.
histoplasmosis.caseContext: Histoplasmosis granulomas contain small yeast forms within macrophages. GMS or PAS staining highlights the organisms.

sarcoidosis.teachingPoint: Noncaseating granulomas in the appropriate clinical setting support sarcoidosis.
sarcoidosis.caseContext: Sarcoidosis features well-formed noncaseating granulomas. Asteroid bodies may be seen but are not specific.

rheumatoid.teachingPoint: Rheumatoid nodules show central necrobiotic material surrounded by palisading histiocytes.
rheumatoid.caseContext: Rheumatoid lung nodules demonstrate necrobiotic granulomas with a fibrinoid center and palisading histiocytes.

stainRoles.PAS: highlight fungal cell walls and mucin
